subject: Critical Thinking
title: Analogical Reasoning: Learning from Similarity
description: A short lesson to help you apply Analogical Reasoning: Learning from Similarity.

hook.text: 'The atom is like a solar system.' That analogy shaped physics for decades ‚Äî and was eventually wrong.

buildup.text: Analogical reasoning: X and Y share properties A, B, C. X also has D. So Y probably has D too.

discovery.text: Analogies drive scientific discovery. Darwin's 'natural selection' borrowed from artificial selection by breeders.

twist.text: But analogies break down. Where two things differ may matter more than where they're similar.

climax.text: The strength of an analogy depends on how relevant the shared properties are to the conclusion.

punchline.text: All analogies are wrong. Some are useful.

quiz.question: What determines the strength of an analogical argument?
options: How relevant the shared properties are to the conclusion
